title: HTML Computer Code Elements
gp1: HTML contains several elements for defining user input and computer code.
gp2: The HTML <kbd> element is used to define keyboard input. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
gp3: The HTML <samp> element is used to define sample output from a computer program. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
gp4: The HTML <code> element  is used to define a piece of computer code. The content inside is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
wp1: The HTML <var> element  is used to define a variable in programming or in a mathematical expression. The content inside is typically displayed in italic.
